author: Jubessin

text: Okay, I haven't seen or played this game before. What's it like (no spoilers) and would it be worth checking out?
author: Violet - 111

text:
Violet - Wolf In my opinion, it's the best RPG on the SNES, maybe one of the best of all time. It's hard to explain what makes it so good because there are a lot of amazing things, from the awesome gameplay mechanics, to the great characters with compelling storylines, to the well written main plot, to the soundtrack, to the fact that the art was done by Akira freaking Toriyama.
I'd love to go into detail on all of this, but it would take too much time, so instead I'd recomend you check out ProJared's review of the game, it will tell you all you need to know.

author: butyraceousbrachiosaurus

text: No, in the DS version he just speaks straight English, which is apparently more "accurate" to the "original version" (TIP: I don't give a damn, I liked Square a lot more before I knew the Japanese versions of their games were all overdramatic, self-pity parties) where Frog has no special accent.  Woolsey added it because he thought it would add to the character and in my opinion it did.  It illustrated how hard he was trying to be a proper knight like his idol Cyrus.  Now he's just a frog.

author: MetalMayhem007

text: Everything is the same except some of the end-game content is new (you can tell because the level design is a lot worse) and all the text is different. The overall plot is the same but the lines are all changed and that changed the personalities and overall atmosphere of the story. The DS version is a lot darker and more depressing than the original, Frog lost his accent which makes him a blander character, and Magus is less badass wizard, more crazy doomsayer. The original was much less serious
